Key Match Events: Mehdi Ghayedi scored the only goal of the match in the 24th minute.
Yapp Hung-fai made a notable save from a Shahriyar Moghanloo header.
Philip Chan missed a significant opportunity for Hong Kong.
Hong Kong coach Jorn Andersen made an attacking triple substitution in the second half.
Pre-Game Insights: Iran was ranked 21st in the world, while Hong Kong was ranked 150th.
Iran was among the favorites for the trophy, aiming for a record-equalling fourth continental crown.
Hong Kong was playing in their first Asian Cup in more than 55 years.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Khalifa International Stadium in Doha.
The attendance for the match was 36,412 spectators.
